metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20444 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
HttpObjectDecoder.java in Netty before 4.1.44 allows an HTTP header thatlacks a colon, which might be interpreted as a separate header with anincorrect syntax, or might be interpreted as an "invalid fold."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:3.2.6.Final-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netty package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.2.6.Final-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1').
